name: Cessna C401 / C402 / C411
overview: The Cessna 401 and 402 are series of 6 to 9 people light twin piston engine aircraft. The Cessna 400 series aircraft has proven to be a very dependable aircraft over the years which, along with its range and passenger capacity have made it a popular choice for many small regional airlines worldwide. The aircraft are generally utilized on short routes for airlines for example to connect from islands to the airlines main hubs inland.

name: Saab 340
overview: The Saab 340 is a Swedish two-engine turboprop aircraft designed and initially produced by a partnership between Saab and Fairchild Aircraft. The plane first flew in 1983. It was originally designated as the SF340, which was later changed to 340A. An improved version of the 340A, the 340B, was introduced in 1989. The SAAB 340 typically seats between 33 and 35 passengers.
features: Cabin crew to enhance safety and comfort
Larger passenger capacity with executive configuration seating

name: Gulfstream G280
overview: The Gulfstream G280 (formerly known as the G250) is the latest edition to the Gulfstream brand; as a result private jet customers can expect state-of-the-art features and excellent performance. Evolved from the innovating G200, the aircraft is capable of flying four passengers 3600nm at Mach 0.85.
features: High speed wing/engine improvements giving favourable short-field performance
Enhanced safety with ‘auto-braking’, an industry first in this market

name: Learjet 60
overview: Bombardier's Learjet 60 is designed for speed. The design of the Learjet 60 was based on the previous model Learjet 55, but added more powerful Pratt & Whitney engines and an improved wing design. The Learjet 60 is notable for its time-to-climb performance, and at a higher altitude it can cruise at speeds up to 0.81 Mach.

name: Citation XLS+
overview: The Citation XLS+ is the newest and most advanced iteration of Cessna's medium jet mainstay. It features updated engines, interior and avionics to ensure passengers are carried in the height of comfort for flights of up to 5 hours.
features: Entertainment options and individual seat monitors
Rosenview Moving Map cabin display system

name: Nextant 400XT/XTi
overview: The Nextant 400XT/XTi is an aircraft that has been re-engineered from the original airframe of the Hawker/ Beechjet 400A aircraft. It offers the benefits of a new, modern aircraft, but with lower operating costs. This results in an 88% new aircraft with increased speed, range and efficiency.
features: Excellent flight range, ahead of other comparable aircraft
Refreshment centre, with hot and cold drinks area

name: Gulfstream G200
overview: Recently renamed from the 'Gulfstream 250', the Gulfstream 280 has everything that could be desired in a private jet: great range, cabin size, and speed. It's the ideal jet for completing long-range flights rapidly and in comfort. Few other super midsize private jets can fly eight passengers 3,680 miles (3,200 nautical miles) at .80 Mach. For that matter, few first-generation private jets are so reliable.

name: Citation Latitude
overview: The Latitude is a mid-sized business jet from Textron-owned Cessna, larger than its well-known Citation XLS+ but more cost-effective than the Citation Sovereign.
features: Wider & taller than other Citation jets
Popular model on the charter market

name: Embraer Legacy 450
overview: Embraer's Legacy 450 is part of the successful Legacy range of midsize to long range executive jets and has been in production since 2015. As with all of the Legacy and Praetor aircraft from Embraer, it has a well-designed spacious cabin and a notably generous luggage capacity.

name: Learjet 55
overview: The Learjet 55/60 is said to have been designed for a niche market, a niche that needs private jets that climb quickly to high cruise levels, have fast cruise speeds, operate economically, and are reliable. It would seem that those features would attract more than a niche worth of buyers, but the important point is that the Learjet 60 more than lives up to its expectations.

name: Falcon 7X
overview: The Falcon 7X is one of Dassault's popular long range jets in its Falcon family. With a flight range of up to 5,950 nm, it links many of the world's city pairs, such as Paris to Tokyo. The aircraft was the first business jet to include 'fly-by-wire' technology (the electronic flight interface as opposed to traditional manual flight controls).

name: Hawker 4000
overview: The Hawker 4000 is a super mid-size private jet that is perfect for longer European flights. Originally named the Hawker Horizon, it strikes a good balance between cabin size, range, speed, and economy. With an eight passenger cabin and transatlantic range, it still manages to reach speeds of 470 knots. The operating costs are reasonably low while other factors such as runway performance stay competitive.

name: Citation XLS
overview: The Citation XLS is a popular and well-established aircraft which is suitable for up to 8 passengers and baggage, for flights across Europe or within the US. The XLS is the upgrade to its predecessor, the Citation XL, with quieter air conditioning and smoother braking.

name: Citation VII
overview: In short, Cessna set out to build a private jet that would improve upon its predecessor and reduce acquisition and operating cost. The resulting Citation VI is a low-priced business jet that delivers comfortable travel accommodations, economic operating costs, and good speed and range capabilities

name: Global 6000
overview: The Global 6000 is the enhanced version of Bombardier's original Global Express - offering improved cruise performance, updated cabin layout and lighting, and a redesigned flight deck. With a range of over 6000nm, the Global 6000 is the perfect choice for business travellers worldwide to connect continents.

name: Embraer Praetor 600
overview: The Praetor 600 is Embraer’s enhanced version of the Legacy 500, with added range. It can fly further thanks to more aerodynamically efficient winglets and additional fuel capacity, making it capable of transatlantic routes and longer flights, such as London to the Middle East.
features: Enhanced version of the Legacy 500 with added range
Can fly between London & New York, or Paris & Dubai

name: Daher TBM 910
overview: The Daher TBM 910 is an upgraded version of the TBM 900, new to the European charter market in 2017. This single-engine turboprop is capable of taking off and landing on very short runways, giving it excellent reach.
features: Able to land on short and mountainous runways

name: Beech 390 Premier 1
overview: The Beechcraft Premier 1 has a uniquely spacious cabin for an aircraft in it's category. It remains popular due to it's performance and comfort, while remaining cost-effective.
features: Spacious cabin and large luggage capacity
Stylish option compared with other light jets

name: Citation X
overview: The Citation X is the fastest private jet in the charter market. It was awarded the prestigious Collier Trophy in its debut year in honour of the advances it had made in aviation and aerospace technology. The Citation X truly is the fastest mid-sized business jet available. It cruises at .90 mach, just under the speed of sound.
features: Fastest private jet on the charter market
Built in restroom and dressing room

name: Cessna C425 Corsair / Conquest I
overview: The Cessna Conquest is one of the best performing small turboprops designed by Cessna. Its high cruise speed makes it a lower cost alternative to a corporate jet. Impressive climb performance and pressurisation system allows the aircraft to climb higher above the weather for passenger comfort.

name: A320 Prestige
overview: The Airbus Prestige can fly large groups as well as smaller teams on short-haul, medium-range and intercontinental routes. It has an increased cruise altitude of 41,000 ft. and an enhanced cabin pressurisation level.
features: Fully equipped hot and cold food kitchen
DVD players and built in phones

name: A318
overview: The Airbus A318 is a short- to-medium range commercial passenger airliner and the smallest version of the A320 family, manufactured by Airbus. The A318 pioneered the use of digital fly-by-wire flight control systems in a commercial aircraft.
features: Flexible classes of seats from VVIP to economy
Cabin crew to enhance safety and comfort

name: EMB 145
overview: The Embraer EMB-145 is a twin-engined regional jet plane with 50 seats. This aircraft has a range of 800 nautical miles and a cruising speed of 430 knots - 70 knots faster than its nearest turbo prop competitor. With operating costs comparable to those of a turbo prop, the EMB-145 is efficient and profitable, while providing the same high level of service in smaller markets that travellers are accustomed to receiving from major carriers.
features: A galley for in-flight food and beverage service
Stand-up head room in the cabin

name: Challenger 604
overview: The impressive Challenger 604's 4000 nm flight range offers non-stop flights, such as London to Chicago, or Riyadh to Paris. And it offers cost-effective charter prices, compared to rival Gulfstreams, Globals or Falcons.

name: Gulfstream G450
overview: The Gulfstream G450 has the ability to carry up to 14 passengers, travel up to 4350 nautical miles at Mach 0.8 and cruise at 45,000 feet. It can handle short domestic flights and transcontinental routes with equal ease.
features: Fully equipped hot and cold food & drink area
Advanced entertainment and cabin management systems

name: Hawker 1000
overview: The Hawker 1000 is the largest jet in the Hawker 800 family. The Hawker 1000 is optimised for long range flights, and was built using lightweight materials, stretched fuselage, and more powerful engines. The Hawker 1000 is popular with fractional jet ownership schemes and jet card holders for its reliability and cost effective long-range flight performance.

name: Dornier 328Jet
overview: The 328 was designed to replace Dornier's existing 19- to 30-seat turboprops. The aircraft usually seats 32 passengers. Its comparatively low cost of acquisition and operation means that the aircraft is cost-efficient with outstanding field performance. It can be operated from short runways, allowing operators to use small airfields.
features: Fully equipped hot and cold food facilities

name: Eclipse 500
overview: The Eclipse 500 is a small or "Very Light Jet" (VLJ) aircraft manufactured by Eclipse Aviation.
features: Cost effective flight to charter for short flights

name: Beech BE200 Super King Air
overview: Step inside the next-generation Beechcraft King Air B200 and you are immediately steeped in a sense of awe. This is the aircraft that changed an industry and now stands alone as the most successful turbine-powered business aircraft model of all time. It earned this distinction by establishing and maintaining a tradition of engineering excellence and exceptional value.
features: Offers access to airports with shorter runways

name: Boeing Business Jet - BBJ
overview: The Boeing Business Jet (BBJ) is usually based on the well-known 737 airliner family. Superb flight range and cruise speeds together with an extremely spacious and versatile cabin make it one of the most prestigious private jets on the VVIP charter market.
features: Excellent flight range and cruise speeds

name: Citation Ultra
overview: The Citation V was upgraded to the Citation Ultra in 1994. The improved wing design offering better fuel efficiency and more cost effective charter prices.

name: The Pilatus PC-24
overview: The Pilatus PC-24 is a business jet aircraft, made by Swiss manufacturer Pilatus which, in designing this aircraft, took many of the characteristics of its highly-popular PC-12 turboprop, and wrapped them up in a jet.
features: Large luggage hold + wide cargo door

name: Cessna Citation Longitude
overview: The Citation Longitude was certified by the FAA in September 2019. With a range of 3,500nm and a cruising speed of 483 kts at 45,000ft, the Citation Longitude is Cessna’s first super-midsize private jet, featuring Garmin’s latest G5000 flight deck avionics.The cross-section of the fuselage on the Citation Longitude is the same as the smaller Citation Latitude; however the Longitude features a T-shaped tail, unlike the Latitude’s conventional tail design. It also features much greater range than the Latitude.Cessna announced the launch of the Citation Longitude in 2012 at industry convention EBACE.

name: Mitsubishi MU-2 Marquise
overview: The Mitsubishi MU-2 is a twin-engine turboprop with a pressurized cabin. Originally designed by Mitsubishi, the aircraft was built in USA by the Mooney Aircraft company.

name: Beechjet 400
overview: The Beechjet 400 is a twin-engine premier executive light jet, well-suited for small groups, on shorter trips.

name: Challenger 850
overview: The largest private jet in the Bombardier range, the Challenger 850 offers excellent long range flight performance. The long flight range (2811 nm / 5206 km) combined with high cruise speeds of Mach 0.8 and Rockwell Collins airliner engines means this is  agreat charter choice for long range flights.
features: Fully equipped hot and cold food and drink galley

name: EMB 135
overview: The EMB-135LR is designed to work best on shorter trips. It can carry more passengers than its predecessor, and is designed to be used as a corporate shuttle for anywhere between 16 and 37 passengers.

name: Cessna 510 Mustang
overview: The Citation Mustang sets the standard in the Very Light Jets (VLJs). Designed to be a low cost upgrade for the twin prop customer, the Mustang offers high performance on a budget. With over 400 aircraft in operation around the globe, the Mustang is PrivateFly's most popular aircraft for flights under 1 hour.
features: First very light jet to be certified by the FAA
Highly cost-effective for private jet charter

name: 1124 Westwind/Westwind1/Westwind2
overview: The Westwind started life as the Aero Commander 1121 Jet Commander or Commodore Jet, a General Electric CJ610 turbojet powered small executive jet based on Aero Commander's successful piston and turboprop twin line.
features: Hot and cold drink and food facility

name: Citation VI
overview: In short, Cessna set out to build a private jet that would improve upon its predecessor and reduce acquisition and operating cost. The resulting Citation VI is a low-priced business jet that delivers comfortable travel accommodations, economic operating costs, and good speed and range capabilities.

name: Boeing 787-Dreamliner
overview: The Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner is well-known as one of the newest large body airliners available in the commercial sector, since 2011. And in common with some of the previous large airliners, manufacturer Boeing has now made the Dreamliner available as a converted VVIP private aircraft.

name: Saab 2000
overview: The Saab 2000 is one of the fastest turboprop airplanes in existence and it is a stretched version of the Saab 340. The aircraft is designed to combine turbo prop fuel and cost efficiency with nearly jet cruise speeds.
features: One of the fastest turbo-props to charter

name: Gulfstream G500
overview: A clean sheet design from Gulfstream which was certified at the end of 2018, the new G500 - not to be confused with an older variant of the GV known by the same name - is the most technically-advanced business jet available in the long range category.
features: Up to 19 lie-flat seats, with bed conversion for longer trips
Fully-equipped galley for hot & cold food & drink preparation

name: Citation CJ2
overview: When Cessna redesigned their original and popular CJ1 private jet, known for its low operating costs and high performance, the result was the CJ2: Bigger, faster, and better. The cabin stretches an additional 33 inches, the wingspan an extra 35. It is faster than the CJ1 with a lower fuel-burn.

name: BA146-300 / Avro RJ100
overview: The BAe 146 (Avro RJ) is regional airliner manufactured by BAE SYSTEMS. The jet engines are mounted above the fuselage and are built to be "whisper" quiet, offering a more comfortable flight for passengers, and allowing the aircraft access to more noise sensitive airports.
features: Economic choice for long range flights

name: Citation CJ2+
overview: The CJ2+ is the fifth member of the popular Citation Jet series. A low-cost, reliable jet, the CJ2+ is a new and improved version of the CJ2, featuring an updated model of the FJ44 engine, a redesigned cockpit, and reduced fuel consumption.

name: BA146-200 / Avro RJ85
overview: It carries its four jet engines on a high wing above the fuselage (not below, or at mid-fuselage, as on most conventional civilian aircraft). The aircraft has STOL capabilities and very quiet operation, so is widely used at small city-based airports. The BA146-200 / Avro RJ85 first flew in August 1982 and entered service six months later. The RJ85 was the first RJ development of the BAe 146 family and features an improved cabin and the more efficient LF 507 s. Deliveries of the RJ85 began in April 1993.
features: The RJ85 seats up to 100 passengers.
One of the quietest jets in production, known as the WhisperJet

name: Challenger 601
overview: Bombardier's Challenger 601 is one of the most popular long range business jets available on the charter market. The aircraft's fuel efficiency, versatile performance and powerful engines combined with spacious cabin offer passengers an excellent option for long range flights.

name: Pilatus PC-12
overview: The Swiss-made Pilatus PC-12 is a corporate commuter and utility turboprop aircraft. It has the capabilities, speed, comfort and safety of a twin-engine turboprop, but is a more cost-effective aircraft option.
features: Large rear cargo door, making it an excellent choice for air ambulance and cargo operations

name: Piper PA61 / Aerostar 601P
overview: Originally manufactured in 1968 at Van Nuys in California by Ted Smith, the Aerostar’s light construction, powerful engines and low levels of drag gave the aircraft impressive performance and became a popular choice of light turboprop.

name: Cessna C525 Citation
overview: The highly successful CitationJet range was developed by Cessna Aircraft Company in the late 1960s. It has since become the world's most popular light jet, in use globally. Excellent performance capabilities make this a versatile aircraft and a popular cost effective choice for jet charter. The C525 is also known as a CitationJet or CJ.
features: Good flight range for a light jet

name: Embraer Legacy 500
overview: The Legacy 500 slots perfectly in between its larger siblings in Embraer's Legacy line-up - the Legacy 600 and 650, and the shorter version, the Legacy 450. It is also a sister aircraft to Embraer's Praetor 600 and Praetor 500.
features: Up to five hours of flight time
Flexible seating with 8 fully adjustable chairs & flat bed option

name: Citation Sovereign
overview: Cessna developed the Sovereign to sit midway between the Excel and the Citation X in both range and price tag. The Sovereign is most economical for charter flights between 4 - 6 hours with 8 passengers.The Citation Sovereign offers a compromise of range, speed and runway performance within the mid-sized jet category. Its cabin is described by many of PrivateFly's members as a stretched version of the Excel. The Sovereign's baggage space is impressively large and best in its class.A Citation Sovereign+ has also been recently received EASA certification. Improvements include a new flight deck with Garmin G5000 avionics and winglets to improve fuel efficiency.
features: Largest baggage space of any medium sized jet

name: Jetstream 31 / 32
overview: The Jetstream aircraft was originally developed by Scottish Aviation, before being taken over by British Aerospace. The famiy of Jetstream aircraft was popular amongst airlines as a small regional airliner, and configured by businesses for VIP use.

name: Embraer Phenom 300 / 300E
overview: Launched in 2009 by Brazilian manufacturer Embraer as a larger version of its successful Phenom 100, the Phenom 300 has since become a firm favourite in the private jet charter market.
features: High performance at an efficient price point

name: Boeing 737-800
overview: The Boeing 737-800 is the most popular of Boeing's 'Next Generation' 737 line. It features advanced avionics, greater performance and enhanced passenger comfort.

name: Cessna C421C Golden Eagle
overview: The Cessna 421 was developed from the Cessna 411, with the addition of a pressurised cabin.  Cessna's 421C model  included "wet wings" or an integral fuel tank, which reduced the aircraft weight and improved the aircraft's aerodynamics - making it more economic to fly. Some aircraft were modified to use a turboprop engine.

name: Hawker 800 / 800XP / 850XP
overview: Few aircraft in its category can match the Hawker 800's combination of comfort, cabin size and range, making it one of the most popular midsize business jets. It is designed to complete transcontinental and international flights as needed, in addition to its good short range capabilities.

name: Piaggio P180 Avanti / Avanti Evo
overview: The Piaggio P180 Avanti, by Italian manufacturer Piaggio Aero Company, is a light and stylish turboprop. The upgraded Avanti EVO variant can fly at 400 knots (faster than some small jets), fly at more than 40,000 feet, and has a 1,500 nm mile range.
features: Spacious cabin with good noise control
Almost as fast as a jet

name: Gulfstream G400 Jet
overview: The Gulfstream 400 (also known as the G-IV Gulfstream GIV or GIV) were based on the popular Gulfstream III aircraft. The wings were re-designed to increase aeordynamics, and fuselage stretched to increase flight range. The Gulfstream 400 can fly up to 3800 nautical miles, at a cruise speed of Mach 0.8.  It can handle domestic jaunts and transcontinental flights with equal ease.
features: Fully equipped hot and cold food / drink area

name: Mitsubishi MU-2
overview: The MU-2 aircraft is manufactured by Mitsubishi is a prop aircraft with a pressurized cabin.

name: The Embraer Praetor 500
overview: One of Embraer's newest aircraft the 8-seater Praetor 500 is the smaller sibling of the Praetor 600. The name Praetor comes from the Latin "to lead the way".
features: Ideal for longer flights of 4 - 7 hours

name: Citation III
overview: In short, Cessna set out to build a private jet that would meet the needs of private jet business travellers in range and speed while keeping costs low and performance high. The resulting Citation III is a low-priced business jet that delivers comfortable travel accommodations, economic operating costs, and good speed and range.

name: Legacy 650/650E
overview: Embraer's Legacy 650 is an advanced and highly-desirable long range jet, and an extended version of the Legacy 600.
features: Embraer's largest model in the Legacy family
Full hot and cold catering facilities

name: Diamond Twin Star
overview: This twin-engined light aircraft is ideal for short-range flights. With new turbo diesel engines it has an outstanding performance and safety record.
features: Able to land on short runways
Greenest aircraft available on charter market

name: Hawker 900
overview: The Hawker 900XP is the best-selling midsized business jet in the world and is a versatile and stylish aircraft. The Hawker 900XP offers increased hot/high-altitude takeoff, climb and cruise performance as well as a 6.9 percent range increase over the Hawker 850XP, by using enhanced winglets and powerful new Honeywell TFE731-50R engines.
features: Excellent flight range for a medium jet

name: Challenger 300
overview: Bombardier's Challenger 300 was designed from a clean sheet, and is perfect for longer flights within Europe, or coast-to-coast in the USA. The Challenger 300 has a large cabin but efficient operating costs, making it a popular choice with clients choosing from the super-midsize private jet category.The Challenger 300 is a solid private jet that consistently delivers on performance, comfort and economy of operation.

name: Citation M2
overview: The Citation M2 is Cessna's newest VLJ (Very Light Jet) and its successor to the highly-successful Citation Mustang - the category leader (which ceased new production in May 2017).

name: G150 Astra
overview: Developed from IAI's Astra business jet in the 1990s, the Gulfstream G100/150 aircraft is a large and executive choice for medium range trips. Under the Gulfstream brand, this aircraft is becoming ever more popular.With 95 aircraft in service, the fleet has flown more than 100,000 flight hours and achieved more than 72,000 landings. In addition, the aircraft is certified in 11 countries and has accomplished 11 city-pair speed records, most recently Gander, Canada, to Geneva, Switzerland, in five hours and seven minutes. Powered by two fuel-efficient Honeywell TFE731-40AR engines, the G150 has a range of 3,000 nautical miles (5,556 km).

name: Canadair Regional Jet CRJ700
overview: Bombardier's CRJ700 family are regional airliners. The CRJ700 was designed to seat up to 70 passengers, althought the CRJ700 family also includes the CRJ701 and CRJ702 which can seat up to a maximum of 78 passengers. The CRJ700 is popular amongst smaller airlines.

name: Beech BE350 King Air
overview: The Beech King Air 350 is twin turboprop passenger business aircraft. The King Air 350 can operate with exceptional performance, due to its highly reliable Pratt & Whitney engines.
features: Quiet cabin with active noise control system
Lower charter cost than a jet
The King Air can land on unpaved runways
